org.gljiva.util.tree
Interface ITreeOp<D,R>

Type Parameters:
D - The data type associated with the tree's nodes.
R - The return type for this operation.
All Known Implementing Classes:
RunOpOncePerNode, TreeOpForData
public interface ITreeOp<D,R>

Author:
bert

Method Summary
 R enterNode(ITreeNode<D> node)
          This method is called when entering the node.
 R exitNode(ITreeNode<D> node, java.util.List<R> childReturnValues)
          This method is called when exiting the node.
 

Method Detail

enterNode

R enterNode(ITreeNode<D> node)
This method is called when entering the node. It may return either null (to continue processing the children) or a non-null value (to "prune" the tree and return early).

If this method returns null, that indicates that the processing should continue with each of the children, after which the exitNode() method will be called.

If this method returns a non-null value, child nodes will not be processed, and exitNode() will not be called. The value returned will be taken as the operation's return value.

Parameters:
node - The current tree node.
Returns:
Null, or the early-return value for the operation on the current node.

exitNode

R exitNode(ITreeNode<D> node,
           java.util.List<R> childReturnValues)
This method is called when exiting the node. Its return value is the operation's return value for this node. If enterNode returns non-null, this method will never be called (nor will any of the methods on this node's children).

For symmetry with enterNode(), returning null from this method is discouraged.

Parameters:
node - The current tree node.
childReturnValues - The list of return values from each of this node's children.
Returns:
The value for the operation on the current node.
